derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (as a verb in the sense 'tuck up around the body'): of Scandinavian origin; compare with Danish kilte (op) 'tuck (up') and Old Norse kilting 'a skirt'. The noun dates from the mid 18th cent

entry.tran: 短褶裙（苏格兰男子的传统服装，亦可为妇女、女孩穿着）
entry.def: A kilt is a skirt with a lot of vertical folds, traditionally worn by Scottish men. Kilts can also be worn by women and girls.

means.word_mean: 1. a knee-length pleated tartan skirt worn by men in the Highlands of northern Scotland
